header.title: Coming Into The Light: Rituals of Egyptian Magick

central_thesis: The book presents ancient Egyptian 'Pert Em Hru' texts as a practical system of 'Magick' (with a 'k') for spiritual evolution, enabling conscious control over life, maintaining continuity of consciousness through death and rebirth, and ultimately achieving the state of a 'Master of the Universe' by understanding and interacting with the subtle planes of the 'Magickal Universe'.

structure_content.summary: This section introduces Egyptian Magick, rectifying historical distortions by positioning it as a 'secret science' for spiritual growth rather than mere illusion. It outlines fundamental concepts such as the 'Magickal Universe' (Neter-Khert), the dual nature of the 'Abyss' (Solidification and Dispersion), the pantheon of 'Gods' as archetypes, and the multi-component 'Bodies of Man', providing a cosmological framework for the rituals.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part II: Introduction to Egyptian Low Magick
structure_content.summary: This part details practical applications of Egyptian Magick for immediate, tangible benefits. It covers rituals for mummification (esoteric interpretation), 'The Magick of Names' for control and authority, healing, protection, preventing possession, and charging 'Amulets' (Isis, Eye of Horus, Tet). A significant focus is on techniques for 'Traveling in the Body of Light' to interact with the subtle planes and communicate with deceased relatives.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part III: Introduction to Egyptian High Magick
structure_content.summary: This section delves into advanced spiritual practices aimed at achieving higher states of consciousness and control over rebirth. It describes a progressive path of 'Mastery' (Earth, Hands, Temple, Stone Mountain, Fire, Universe) through various rituals associated with deities like Ra, Osiris, and Aten. Key themes include maintaining consciousness during 'disembodiment processes', 'Opening the Mouth' for clear communication in the subtle realms, and undergoing 'Transformations' into divine forms.

This section provides practical, step-by-step instructions for the physical construction of key magical tools. It includes detailed guides for crafting the 'Amulet of Isis', the 'Eye of Horus', and the 'Tet' from specific materials, noting their magical properties and the importance of personal creation or skilled craftsmanship.

key_concepts.definition: A 'secret science' distinct from common illusion, aimed at uncovering illusion and error, guiding the 'Child of Man' to correct living and spiritual evolution. It involves deliberate use of will to effect change in self or environment.

The Egyptian title for the texts commonly known as 'The Book of the Dead', translating to 'Coming Into Light' or 'Appearing with Light/Sun'. It refers to a process of achieving conscious awareness, particularly in a creative and spiritually advanced sense.

The invisible subtle planes and subplanes existing beyond the physical Earth (etheric, astral, mental, spiritual), which are visited by the dead and skilled magicians. Life and experiences within Neter-Khert are as varied and personal as on Earth, dependent on an individual's 'maat' (karma).

A central operative technique in which a magician consciously transfers their consciousness to their 'Body of Light', causing it to assume the form and personality characteristics of a specific deity. This allows the magician to channel and wield 'godly power and wisdom'.

The living, subtle aura that pervades and extends beyond the physical body, composed of seven 'layers' (physical, etheric, astral, mental, causal, spiritual, divine). It is the vehicle for conscious travel in the 'Magickal Universe' and for maintaining consciousness through death and rebirth.

A chaotic and transitional region in the 'Magickal Universe' located above the 'Tuat' (astral plane). It comprises a 'Subplane of Solidification' (governed by Isis, associated with birth and form) and a 'Subplane of Dispersion' (governed by Nephthys, associated with death and dissolution). Magicians navigate it to maintain consciousness during rebirth cycles.

The universal law of cause and effect, truth, justice, and righteousness, personified by the goddess Maat. The concept of 'karma' is central to understanding progression within the 'Magickal Universe', particularly in the 'Hall of Maati' where one's 'heart' is weighed.

An initiate who has successfully undergone the Egyptian system of magick and achieved a state of being akin to the god Osiris, characterized by truth-speaking, mastery over self, and control over the cycles of reincarnation and consciousness.

A magical operation (using instruments like the urhekau or seb-ur) to enable the magician or deceased's subtle body (ka) to communicate actively with its surroundings in the 'Magickal Universe', preventing absorption into its own psychic contents and ensuring conscious interaction.

A multi-faceted symbol representing protection, knowledge, consciousness, and power. As a magically charged talisman, it grants control over astral forces and serves as a means to achieve an initiated consciousness that balances creative (Ra) and destructive (Set) spiritual aspects, leading to perfection.

practical_system.description: The practical system is a synthesis of 'Low Magick' for immediate benefits and 'High Magick' for spiritual evolution. It heavily relies on 'assumption of god-forms' to channel divine powers, visualization for navigating the 'Magickal Universe' (Neter-Khert), and the recitation of 'words of power' (hekau). A core aspect is developing the 'Body of Light' for out-of-body travel and maintaining 'continuity of consciousness' through death and rebirth, thereby overcoming the 'dissociation phase' that typically leads to memory loss.
tools: God-like images or statues (Tem, Horus Hekennu, Isis, Horus, golden ba)
Urhekau (snake's head on curved rod, iron tool)
Shabti figures (clay or wood, crafted in magician's likeness)
Flaming torches (figurines representing Pillars of Horus)
Offerings (bread, cakes, wine, beer, elixirs, ointments, meat, fruit, grain, milk)

relevant_quotes.text: Magick... with a 'k' ... then is the 'secret science' that uncovers illusion and error, and that guides the Child of Man to correct living.
Except a man be born again he cannot enter the Kingdom of God.

The true will of a Master of the Earth is unchanging. They have command. They have rank. They have houses where they train. They have music, and they have gods. Their cities correspond to their thinking and their government corresponds to their word.

My consciousness is supported from discontinuities and from loss of consciousness. My consciousness is supported with my head toward the horizon. Because of my attachments, I have been truth-speaking and the god Ptah has cast down my enemies. He has cast down my enemies and they no longer exist for me.

I am an Osirified magician. I say to you: May you allow me to come into your presence O Divine Lord of Amentet. There are no defects in my body, nor in my speech, and I have retained consciousness. May I be received like the Favored Ones who dwell with you, O Osiris; a greatly favored one of the beautiful god, beloved of the Lord of the Two Lands. I am a magician of the law, the beloved one who is truth-speaking before Osiris.

critical_analysis.relevance: The book presents ancient Egyptian magical texts, particularly from the Pert Em Hru, not as mere historical artifacts but as a living, operative system for spiritual development. It contextualizes these practices within Western occult traditions (Golden Dawn, Rosicrucianism) and draws parallels to Eastern philosophies (Tibetan Buddhism, Kundalini Yoga), highlighting their continued relevance for modern practitioners seeking conscious control, continuity of consciousness, and transcendence of karmic limitations. By providing translations and ritual outlines, it aims to make previously obscure knowledge accessible for direct application.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is serious practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism with a foundational understanding of magical theory. It particularly appeals to those interested in Egyptian Magick, astral projection, god-form assumption, and self-initiation. The text assumes a certain level of commitment and prior knowledge, advising beginners to master 'Low Magick' before advancing to 'High Magick', and emphasizing the importance of 'truth-speaking' and philosophical understanding for safe and effective practice.
